head.title: Executives Promoted At New York Times

hedline.hl1: Executives Promoted At New York Times

abstract.p: New York Times promotes Rhonda Novick to vice president, consumer marketing; Roland Caputo is named to newly created position of vice president for business development; Rick Ueland is promoted to president of City and Suburban Delivery Systems Inc, which has primary responsibilty for wholesale delivery of newspaper in New York region, succeeding Caputo; will also retain title of executive director of newspaper's circulation operations (S)

block.p: Promotions of three executives in the circulation department of The New York Times were announced yesterday by Scott Heekin-Canedy, the newspaper's senior vice president for circulation.

Rhonda Novick, who is 37 and who came to The Times in 1998 from American Express's division of travel related services, has been promoted to vice president, consumer marketing. For the last two years, Ms. Novick has been been director of relationship marketing at the newspaper.
Promotions of three executives in the circulation department of The New York Times were announced yesterday by Scott Heekin-Canedy, the newspaper's senior vice president for circulation.

Rhonda Novick, who is 37 and who came to The Times in 1998 from American Express's division of travel related services, has been promoted to vice president, consumer marketing. For the last two years, Ms. Novick has been been director of relationship marketing at the newspaper.

Before spending 12 years at American Express in marketing research, charge card retention and relationship marketing, Ms. Novick was a market researcher for Grey Advertising. She is a graduate of the Wharton School with a bachelor's degree in economics.

Roland Caputo, 40, was named to the newly created position of vice president for business development. He has been president of City and Suburban Delivery Systems Inc., which has primary responsibility for wholesale delivery of the newspaper in the New York region, since January 1999.
Mr. Caputo has been involved in the planning and operations of The Times's two major printing plants, in Edison, N.J., and College Point, Queens.
Rick Ueland, who is 52, has been promoted to president of City and Suburban. He will also retain the title of executive director of the newspaper's circulation operations.

A former manager for federal agencies, including the Federal Aviation Administration and the General Accounting Office, Mr. Ueland has also been president of a credit and collections agency, International Media Concepts, which provides services to The Times.
